text: JUST IN: Bitcoin SV, the network that split off from the Bitcoin Cash blockchain in late 2018, has cut its miners’ block reward in half for the first time. @WolfieZhao reports.https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-svs-first-halving-crimps-profits-for-bsv-miners …

3/ In the past, blockchain "halving events" preceded cryptocurrency price rallies, but bitcoin cash saw no such bull run. @DanielGKuhn recapped coverage of Wednesday’s $BCH halving:https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-cash-halved-defi-gets-a-boost-and-bisq-halts-trading …

These "halving events" are usually preceded by cryptocurrency price rallies, but industry experts had doubts a bull run was in store for bitcoin cash. https://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-cash-halved-defi-gets-a-boost-and-bisq-halts-trading …

Bitcoin cash saw its first halving today at 12:20 UTC (8:20 EST), which boosted its price 6% in the 12 hours before the event. Does this foreshadow how bitcoin may react on its own halving next month? Here’s what happened in the $BCH halving run-up: Image: @coindeskdatapic.twitter.com/u34TBSr0Ad
